fields.value: Replication data for: Green Bank Telescope Survey of the Galactic Center

dsDescriptionValue.value: Three FITS format images of the Galactic center made by the Green Bank Telescope. Radio continuum emission was observed in L, C, and X bands (1.4, 5, and 8 GHz frequencies) over roughly the central degree of the Galaxy. Calibration and image processing has been applied, as discussed in the original publication. The flux scale is accurate on small size scales, but image filtering has removed the large-scale emission (along with many calibration artifacts).

publicationCitation.value: @ARTICLE{2008ApJS..177..255L,    author = {{Law}, C.~J. and {Yusef-Zadeh}, F. and {Cotton}, W.~D. and {Maddalena}, R.~J. 	},     title = "{Green Bank Telescope Multiwavelength Survey of the Galactic Center Region}",   journal = {\apjs}, archivePrefix = "arXiv",    eprint = {0801.4294},  keywords = {Galaxy: Center, Radio Continuum: General, Surveys},      year = 2008,     month = jul,    volume = 177,     pages = {255-274},       doi = {10.1086/533587},    adsurl = {http://adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2008ApJS..177..255L},   adsnote = {Provided by the SAO/NASA Astrophysics Data System} }

files.description: C band (5 GHz) continuum map of the Galactic Center. This is a FITS file with 1 HDU of type Image The following recognized metadata keys have been found in the FITS file, and their values will be made searchable in the DVN, once the study has been indexed:  HISTORY; TELESCOP; DATE-OBS; ORIGIN;
